trans-unit.source: Job preparation and cleanup in Batch | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Job preparation and cleanup in Batch | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Employ job-level preparation tasks to minimize data transfer to Azure Batch compute nodes, and release tasks for node cleanup at job completion.
trans-unit.target: Employ job-level preparation tasks to minimize data transfer to Azure Batch compute nodes, and release tasks for node cleanup at job completion.

trans-unit.source: Run job preparation and completion tasks on Azure Batch compute nodes
trans-unit.target: Run job preparation and completion tasks on Azure Batch compute nodes

trans-unit.source: Azure Batch jobs often require some form of setup prior to execution, and similarly, some sort of post-job maintenance after the job's tasks are completed.
trans-unit.target: Azure Batch jobs often require some form of setup prior to execution, and similarly, some sort of post-job maintenance after the job's tasks are completed.

trans-unit.source: Batch provides the mechanisms for this preparation and maintenance in the form of optional *job preparation* and *job release* tasks.
trans-unit.target: Batch provides the mechanisms for this preparation and maintenance in the form of optional *job preparation* and *job release* tasks.

trans-unit.source: Before any of a job's tasks run, the job preparation task runs on all compute nodes that are scheduled to run tasks.
trans-unit.target: Before any of a job's tasks run, the job preparation task runs on all compute nodes that are scheduled to run tasks.

trans-unit.source: Once the job is completed, the job release task runs on each node in the pool that executed at least one task.
trans-unit.target: Once the job is completed, the job release task runs on each node in the pool that executed at least one task.

trans-unit.source: For both job preparation and release tasks, you can specify a command line to invoke when the task is run.
trans-unit.target: For both job preparation and release tasks, you can specify a command line to invoke when the task is run.

trans-unit.source: These special tasks offer familiar task features such as file download, elevated execution, custom environment variables, maximum execution duration, retry count, and file retention time.
trans-unit.target: These special tasks offer familiar task features such as file download, elevated execution, custom environment variables, maximum execution duration, retry count, and file retention time.

trans-unit.source: In the following sections, you'll find out how to use these two special task types by using the [JobPreparationTask][net_job_prep] class and [JobReleaseTask][net_job_release] class in the [Batch .NET][api_net] API.
trans-unit.target: In the following sections, you'll find out how to use these two special task types by using the [JobPreparationTask][net_job_prep] class and [JobReleaseTask][net_job_release] class in the [Batch .NET][api_net] API.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] Job preparation and release tasks are especially helpful in "shared pool" environments--those environments in which a pool of compute nodes persists between job runs, and is shared between many different jobs.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] Job preparation and release tasks are especially helpful in "shared pool" environments--those environments in which a pool of compute nodes persists between job runs, and is shared between many different jobs.

trans-unit.source: When to use job preparation and release tasks
trans-unit.target: When to use job preparation and release tasks

trans-unit.source: A number of situations benefit from job preparation and release tasks.
trans-unit.target: A number of situations benefit from job preparation and release tasks.

trans-unit.source: Here are just a few:
trans-unit.target: Here are just a few:

trans-unit.source: Transfer of common task data
trans-unit.target: Transfer of common task data

trans-unit.source: Batch jobs often require a common set of data as input for the job's tasks.
trans-unit.target: Batch jobs often require a common set of data as input for the job's tasks.

trans-unit.source: For example, in daily risk analysis calculations, market data is job specific, yet common to all of the tasks in the job.
trans-unit.target: For example, in daily risk analysis calculations, market data is job specific, yet common to all of the tasks in the job.

trans-unit.source: This market data, often several gigabytes in size, should be downloaded to each compute node only once so that any task that runs on a node can use it.
trans-unit.target: This market data, often several gigabytes in size, should be downloaded to each compute node only once so that any task that runs on a node can use it.

trans-unit.source: Use a *job preparation task* to download the data to each node before the execution of the job's other tasks.
trans-unit.target: Use a *job preparation task* to download the data to each node before the execution of the job's other tasks.

trans-unit.source: Job data deletion
trans-unit.target: Job data deletion

trans-unit.source: Within a shared pool environment in which a pool's compute nodes are not decommissioned between jobs, deleting job data between runs might be needed--to conserve disk space on the nodes or to satisfy an organization's security policies.
trans-unit.target: Within a shared pool environment in which a pool's compute nodes are not decommissioned between jobs, deleting job data between runs might be needed--to conserve disk space on the nodes or to satisfy an organization's security policies.

trans-unit.source: Use a *job release task* to delete data that was downloaded by a job preparation task or generated during task execution.
trans-unit.target: Use a *job release task* to delete data that was downloaded by a job preparation task or generated during task execution.

trans-unit.source: Log retention
trans-unit.target: Log retention

trans-unit.source: You might want to keep a copy of log files that your tasks generate, or perhaps crash dump files that can be generated by failed applications.
trans-unit.target: You might want to keep a copy of log files that your tasks generate, or perhaps crash dump files that can be generated by failed applications.

trans-unit.source: Use a *job release task* in such cases to compress and upload this data to an [Azure Storage][azure_storage] account.
trans-unit.target: Use a *job release task* in such cases to compress and upload this data to an [Azure Storage][azure_storage] account.

trans-unit.source: Job preparation task
trans-unit.target: Job preparation task

trans-unit.source: Prior to the execution of a job's tasks, the job preparation task is executed on each compute node that is scheduled to run a task.
trans-unit.target: Prior to the execution of a job's tasks, the job preparation task is executed on each compute node that is scheduled to run a task.

trans-unit.source: By default, the Batch service will wait for the job preparation task to be completed before running the tasks scheduled to execute on the node.
trans-unit.target: By default, the Batch service will wait for the job preparation task to be completed before running the tasks scheduled to execute on the node.

trans-unit.source: However, you can configure the service not to wait.
trans-unit.target: However, you can configure the service not to wait.

trans-unit.source: The job preparation task will run again on a compute node if the node restarts, but you can also disable this behavior.
trans-unit.target: The job preparation task will run again on a compute node if the node restarts, but you can also disable this behavior.

trans-unit.source: The job preparation task is only executed on nodes that are scheduled to run a task.
trans-unit.target: The job preparation task is only executed on nodes that are scheduled to run a task.

trans-unit.source: This prevents the unnecessary execution of a preparation task in case a node is not assigned a task.
trans-unit.target: This prevents the unnecessary execution of a preparation task in case a node is not assigned a task.

trans-unit.source: This can occur when the number of tasks for a job is less than the number of nodes in a pool.
trans-unit.target: This can occur when the number of tasks for a job is less than the number of nodes in a pool.

trans-unit.source: It also applies when [concurrent task execution](batch-parallel-node-tasks.md) is enabled, which leaves some nodes idle if the task count is lower than the total possible concurrent tasks.
trans-unit.target: It also applies when [concurrent task execution](batch-parallel-node-tasks.md) is enabled, which leaves some nodes idle if the task count is lower than the total possible concurrent tasks.

trans-unit.source: By not running the job preparation task on idle nodes, you can spend less money on data transfer charges.
trans-unit.target: By not running the job preparation task on idle nodes, you can spend less money on data transfer charges.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] [JobPreparationTask][net_job_prep_cloudjob] differs from [CloudPool.StartTask][pool_starttask] in that JobPreparationTask executes at the start of each job, whereas StartTask executes only when a compute node first joins a pool or restarts.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] [JobPreparationTask][net_job_prep_cloudjob] differs from [CloudPool.StartTask][pool_starttask] in that JobPreparationTask executes at the start of each job, whereas StartTask executes only when a compute node first joins a pool or restarts.

trans-unit.source: Job release task
trans-unit.target: Job release task

trans-unit.source: Once a job is marked as completed, the job release task is executed on each node in the pool that executed at least one task.
trans-unit.target: Once a job is marked as completed, the job release task is executed on each node in the pool that executed at least one task.

trans-unit.source: You mark a job as completed by issuing a terminate request.
trans-unit.target: You mark a job as completed by issuing a terminate request.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service then sets the job state to *terminating*, terminates any active or running tasks associated with the job, and runs the job release task.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service then sets the job state to *terminating*, terminates any active or running tasks associated with the job, and runs the job release task.

trans-unit.source: The job then moves to the *completed* state.
trans-unit.target: The job then moves to the *completed* state.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Job deletion also executes the job release task.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Job deletion also executes the job release task.

trans-unit.source: However, if a job has already been terminated, the release task is not run a second time if that job is subsequently deleted.
trans-unit.target: However, if a job has already been terminated, the release task is not run a second time if that job is subsequently deleted.

trans-unit.source: Job preparation and release tasks in the Batch .NET API
trans-unit.target: Job preparation and release tasks in the Batch .NET API

trans-unit.source: To specify a job preparation task, you create and configure a [JobPreparationTask][net_job_prep] object and assign it to your job's [CloudJob.JobPreparationTask][net_job_prep_cloudjob] property.
trans-unit.target: To specify a job preparation task, you create and configure a [JobPreparationTask][net_job_prep] object and assign it to your job's [CloudJob.JobPreparationTask][net_job_prep_cloudjob] property.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, initialize [JobReleaseTask][net_job_release] and assign it to your job's [CloudJob.JobReleaseTask][net_job_prep_cloudjob] property to set the job's release task.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, initialize [JobReleaseTask][net_job_release] and assign it to your job's [CloudJob.JobReleaseTask][net_job_prep_cloudjob] property to set the job's release task.

trans-unit.source: In this code snippet, `myBatchClient` is a fully initialized instance of [BatchClient][net_batch_client], and `myPool` is an existing pool within the Batch account.
trans-unit.target: In this code snippet, `myBatchClient` is a fully initialized instance of [BatchClient][net_batch_client], and `myPool` is an existing pool within the Batch account.

trans-unit.source: As mentioned above, the release task is executed when a job is terminated or deleted.
trans-unit.target: As mentioned above, the release task is executed when a job is terminated or deleted.

trans-unit.source: Terminating a job with the Batch .NET API is performed by calling [PoolOperations.TerminateJobAsync][net_job_terminate].
trans-unit.target: Terminating a job with the Batch .NET API is performed by calling [PoolOperations.TerminateJobAsync][net_job_terminate].

trans-unit.source: Job deletion is performed with [PoolOperations.DeleteJobAsync][net_job_delete].
trans-unit.target: Job deletion is performed with [PoolOperations.DeleteJobAsync][net_job_delete].

trans-unit.source: Both of these actions are typically done when a job's tasks are completed or when a timeout that you've defined has been reached.
trans-unit.target: Both of these actions are typically done when a job's tasks are completed or when a timeout that you've defined has been reached.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Sample project on GitHub
trans-unit.target: Sample project on GitHub

trans-unit.source: Check out the [JobPrepRelease][job_prep_release_sample] sample project on GitHub to see job preparation and release tasks in action.
trans-unit.target: Check out the [JobPrepRelease][job_prep_release_sample] sample project on GitHub to see job preparation and release tasks in action.

trans-unit.source: This console application does the following:
trans-unit.target: This console application does the following:

trans-unit.source: Creates a pool with two "small" nodes.
trans-unit.target: Creates a pool with two "small" nodes.

trans-unit.source: Creates a job with job preparation, release, and standard tasks.
trans-unit.target: Creates a job with job preparation, release, and standard tasks.

trans-unit.source: Runs the job preparation task, which first writes the node ID to a text file in a node's "shared" directory.
trans-unit.target: Runs the job preparation task, which first writes the node ID to a text file in a node's "shared" directory.

trans-unit.source: Runs a task on each node that writes its task ID to the same text file.
trans-unit.target: Runs a task on each node that writes its task ID to the same text file.

trans-unit.source: Once all tasks are completed (or the timeout is reached), prints the contents of each node's text file to the console.
trans-unit.target: Once all tasks are completed (or the timeout is reached), prints the contents of each node's text file to the console.

trans-unit.source: When the job is completed, runs the job release task to delete the file from the node.
trans-unit.target: When the job is completed, runs the job release task to delete the file from the node.

trans-unit.source: Prints the exit codes of the job preparation and release tasks for each node on which they executed.
trans-unit.target: Prints the exit codes of the job preparation and release tasks for each node on which they executed.

trans-unit.source: Pauses execution to allow confirmation of job and/or pool deletion.
trans-unit.target: Pauses execution to allow confirmation of job and/or pool deletion.

trans-unit.source: Output from the sample application is similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: Output from the sample application is similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Inspect job preparation and release tasks with Batch Explorer
trans-unit.target: Inspect job preparation and release tasks with Batch Explorer

trans-unit.source: The [Azure Batch Explorer][batch_explorer_article], which is also found in the Batch [sample code repository][batch_explorer_project] on GitHub, is an excellent tool to use when you're developing solutions with Azure Batch.
trans-unit.target: The [Azure Batch Explorer][batch_explorer_article], which is also found in the Batch [sample code repository][batch_explorer_project] on GitHub, is an excellent tool to use when you're developing solutions with Azure Batch.

trans-unit.source: For example, when you're running the above sample application, you can use Batch Explorer to view the properties of the job and its tasks, or even download the shared text file that is modified by the job's tasks.
trans-unit.target: For example, when you're running the above sample application, you can use Batch Explorer to view the properties of the job and its tasks, or even download the shared text file that is modified by the job's tasks.

trans-unit.source: The screenshot below highlights the job preparation and release task properties that are shown in the **Job Details** pane when you select the *JobPrepReleaseSampleJob* job on the **Jobs** tab.
trans-unit.target: The screenshot below highlights the job preparation and release task properties that are shown in the **Job Details** pane when you select the *JobPrepReleaseSampleJob* job on the **Jobs** tab.

trans-unit.source: Batch Explorer
trans-unit.target: Batch Explorer

trans-unit.target: Batch Explorer screenshot showing job preparation and release tasks
